globals module¶

Global constants, enums, and data structures for syntax tree processing.

class globals.Feature(value)¶

Bases: Enum

Represents feature values for linguistic properties.

MINUS = 1¶

Node or word doesn’t have this feature.

PLUS = 0¶

Node or word has this feature.

QUESTION = 2¶

Node or word might or might not have this feature.

class globals.FeatureIndex(value)¶

Bases: IntEnum

Feature indices for linguistic properties.

ANF = 6¶

Animate Feature

FPF = 1¶

First Person Feature

GEN = 8¶

Genitive Feature

GNF = 5¶

Gender Feature

PLF = 4¶

Plural Feature

PNF = 0¶

Pronoun Feature

RPF = 7¶

Reflexive Feature

SPF = 2¶

Second Person Feature

TPF = 3¶

Third Person Feature

globals.Features¶

Type alias for a list of Feature enums representing linguistic properties.

globals.HIDE_GEN = False¶

GEN introduced by Chapter 12 in M.S. thesis

class globals.Manager¶

Bases: object

A singleton class for managing output streams and file types.

The Manager class centralizes state management for output streams and file types used in the application. It maintains a stack of states to allow nested context management with automatic state restoration. The class supports Python “with statement” to manage the active state context and provides class-level methods and properties for accessing and updating the current state.

class globals.Node¶

Bases: object

Base node class for syntax tree representation.

Contains fields for tree structure (links), features, and node-specific properties. Different node types (C, S, N, E) use different subsets of these fields.

property ftr_str: str¶
classmethod set_tree(new_tree)¶

Sets the global syntax tree.

Parameters

new_tree (Node) –

Return type

None

classmethod tree()¶

Gets the global syntax tree.

Return type

Optional[Node]

class globals.NodeId(value)¶

Bases: Enum

Identifies the type of node in the syntax tree.

C_NODE = 0¶

Type of Node which represents a C-node.

E_NODE = 3¶

Type of Node which represents an E-node.

N_NODE = 2¶

Type of Node which represents an N-node.

S_NODE = 1¶

Type of Node which represents an S-node.

class globals.Summary¶

Bases: object

Static class to track various info counts in the project.

Contains five integer counters that can be accessed and modified by any module: - meaningless: Counter for meaningless items - meaningful: Counter for meaningful items - ambiguous: Counter for ambiguous items - correct: Counter for correct items - total: Total number of items

ambiguous: int = 0¶
correct: int = 0¶
meaningful: int = 0¶
meaningless: int = 0¶
classmethod reset()¶

Resets all counters to zero.

Return type

None

total: int = 0¶
